contextId.information: These two phrases are similar and used to emphasize what Jesus wanted the wind and the sea to do. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The words "Listen" and "understand" are related. Jesus uses them together to emphasize that his hearers should pay close attention to what he is saying. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: Listen to me, all of you, and understand

contextId.information: These two terms have a common meaning and are repeated here for emphasis. They can be combined. AT: "Keep watch" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: Keep watch and be on guard

contextId.information: Both "know" and "understand" have the same meaning here. The meaning is repeated to add emphasis to what Peter is saying. AT: "I really do not understand what you are talking about!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: neither know nor understand what you are talking about
